svg:
WEL {/* Tagline is kept here for uses where HTML text isn't possible, but will be hidden/cropped in main web usage if we follow the HTML text strategy purely, or we can use a version without tagline. However, user said: "no incrustes el texto... si vas a traducir". The user GAVE this code. I will stick to it as the 'base' logo file, but in the component I might only show the top part or I might just use the SVG as is for 'logo' and allow the component to handle the tagline text separately if I can separate them. Actually, the user said "Copia este código... Este es tu activo digital". But then said "Orden Técnica... no incrustes el texto...". Wait, the user gave the SVG *WITH* the tagline. "1. Tu Logo Maestro (Código SVG)... " "2. Orden Técnica... no incrustes el texto... Si vas a traducir... El Símbolo WELL: Es la imagen... El Tagline: Es texto HTML".
Okay, I should probably create TWO SVGs or just one generally usable one. If I use the user's SVG code exactly, it contains the tagline. To follow the "Strategy", I should probably REMOVE the tagline from the SVG I use on the site if I'm rendering it as HTML. OR, the user meant "Don't bake it into a PNG". "Copia este código... guárdalo como logo-well.svg". I will follow this instruction. But for the website implementation, I will likely obscure it or provide a version without it if needed. Actually, looking at the y positions: "WELL" is at y=80. Tagline at y=115. If I just use the SVG, I can't translate the tagline inside it easily without JS manipulation of the DOM.
Refined Plan: 1. Save `logo-well.svg` exactly as provided (Master). 2. Save `logo-well-symbol.svg` (Only "WELL") for the website usage where HTML tagline is used. 3. Save `logo-well-dark.svg` (Inverted).
Let's stick to the user's explicit code for `logo-well.svg`. */} WEDDINGS & EVENTS
